com.percussion.extension
Interface IPSRequestPreProcessor

All Superinterfaces:

All Known Subinterfaces:
IPSItemInputTransformer
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSAddAllowableWorkflowsForContentType, PSAddCurrentDateTime, PSAuthenticateUser, PSCalculateCompareRevision, PSCascadeDelete, PSCheckIfVariantIsInUse, PSCollapseHtmlParameter, PSConvertCustomSearchOperator, PSCopyParameter, PSDeleteContent, PSDeleteContent, PSFileInfo, PSGetAndSetCxOptions, PSGetSessionVariable, PSImageInfoExtractor, PSMakeDeleteRowsXmlDoc, PSModifyCommunity, PSModifyRelatedContent, PSNullIf, PSParameterTokenizer, PSParamExtractor, PSParamStringListToMultiParams, PSPrepareInClause, PSPublishEditionForPreview, PSRemoveControlChars, PSSearchCommunityHandler, PSSetArrayHtmlParameter, PSSetHtmlParameter, PSSetSessionVariable, PSSplitDateParam, PSSysTemplateToSysVariantid, PSTouchContentAndParentItems, PSTranslationConstraint, PSUploadFileAttrs, PSValidateSlotName, PSWepFixImages, PSXdDomToFile, PSXdDomToParams, PSXdDomToText, PSXdMoveInputDocument, PSXdProcessRelatedLinks, PSXdTextCleanup, PSXdTextToDom, PSXdTransformDom, PSXdTransformDomToText
public interface IPSRequestPreProcessor
extends IPSExtension

The IPSRequestPreProcessor interface must be implemented by extensions which pre-process the request.

When Rhythmyx receives the request, it breaks the request down into the CGI variables, cookies, HTML parameters and the input XML document which were sent with the request. The information stored with the request can then be validated or authenticated. If a validation exception is thrown, the Rhythmyx server will continue to check if another request handler is defined for this request which does pass the selection criteria. If no other handler is found, or if an authentication exception was thrown, an error response will be returned.

Any changes to the data (CGI variables, input XML document, etc.) will be made available to the application during processing.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
Tas Giakouminakis

Method Detail

preProcessRequest

void preProcessRequest(Object[] params,
                       IPSRequestContext request)
                       throws PSAuthorizationException,
                              PSRequestValidationException,
                              PSParameterMismatchException,
                              PSExtensionProcessingException
Performs any pre-processing on the request.

When Rhythmyx receives the request, it breaks the request down into components sent with the request: CGI variables, cookies, HTML parameters, and the input XML document. The information stored with the request can then be validated or authenticated. If a validation exception (PSRequestValidationException) or an authentication exception (PSAuthorizationException) is thrown, an error response will be returned.

Any changes to the data (CGI variables, input XML document, etc.) is available to the application during processing.

NOTE: The implementation of this method must be safe for multi-threaded use. One instance of the extension will be defined for each usage of the handler across all applications.

When processing requests, the same instance may be accessed by several request threads, each thread with its own set of data. As such, any variables used during run-time execution should be defined within the method (not the class). Another alternative is to use variables of type java.lang.ThreadLocal to define thread specific copies of the variable.

Parameters:
params - the parameter values supplied with the request in the appropriate order, as specified by the parameter definitions returned by the IPSExtensionDef.getRuntimeParameter method.
request - the request context object
Throws:
PSAuthorizationException - If the user is not authorized to perform this request.
PSRequestValidationException - If the request does not meet the required validation rules.
PSParameterMismatchException - If a call to setParamValues was never made, or the runtime parameters specified in that call are incorrect for the usage of this extension.
PSExtensionProcessingException - If any other exception occurs which prevents the proper handling of this request
